Sample.Title: React single-page application calling a protected web API using App Roles to implement Role-Based Access Control
Sample.Description: React single-page application calling a protected web API using App Roles to implement Role-Based Access Control

AppRoles.Name: TaskAdmin
AppRoles.Description: Admins can read any user's todo list

AppRoles.Name: TaskUser
AppRoles.Description: Users can read and modify their todo lists

AppRoles.Name: Todolist.Read.All
AppRoles.Description: Application can only read Todo list

AppRoles.Name: Todolist.ReadWrite.All
AppRoles.Description: Application can read and write into Todo list

ManualSteps.Comment: To receive the 'roles' claim with the name of the app roles this user is assigned to, make sure that the user accounts you plan to sign-in to this app is assigned to the app roles of this service instance. The guide, https://aka.ms/userassignmentrequired provides step by step instructions.
Or you can run the ..\CreateUsersAndAssignRoles.ps1 command to automatically create a number of users, and assign these users to the app roles of this app.
